title.narrative: Guyana Petroleum Resources Governance and Management Project

description.narrative: The project development objective is to support the enhancement of legal and institutional frameworks and the strengthening of the capacity of key institutions to manage the oil and gas sector in Guyana.

condition.narrative: Schedule 2, Section B.1. The Government, through the MOTP, shall carry out the Project in accordance with the provisions of amanual (the “Project Operations Manual”) acceptable to IDA.

Schedule 2, Section C.1.(b) The Government, through the MOTP, shall ensure that for the purposes of implementing Part B.4(a) ofthe Project: (A) the SESA is prepared, consulted, disclosed and adopted in accordance with the SESA TORs; and (B) therecommendations of the SESA are applied during Project implementation, as applicable, all in a manner acceptable to IDA.

Schedule 2, Section C.2 The Government, through the MOTP, shall ensure that: (a) all consultancies related to technicalassistance, design and capacity building under the Project, the application of whose results could have environmental, social andhealth and safety implications, as determined by IDA, shall only be undertaken pursuant to terms of reference reviewed and foundsatisfactory by IDA; and (b) such terms of reference shall require the technical assistance, design and capacity buildingactivities to take into account the requirements of the applicable Safeguards Policies and EHS Guidelines, and to be based on GIIP.

Schedule 2, Section I.A. The Government, through the MOTP, shall operate and maintain throughout Project implementation, aProject Implementation Unit (the “PIU”) with staff, functions and responsibilities acceptable to IDA, and as set forth in theProject Operations Manual.

title.narrative: Draft legal acts and regulations for the O&G sector finalized
Stakeholder consultations conducted on new legislation for O&G sector
Communications strategy on O&G sector issues implemented
Legal and regulatory acts for the O&G sector prepared under the project and submitted to the National Assembly
Staff trained on petroleum data management
Instrumental advisors recruited to support critical technical needs at key institutions with responsibility for O&G sector
Number of females in management and leadership positions at key institutions with responsibility for O&G increased
Annual report of the Natural Resource Fund laid before the National Assembly by the MOF
EITI reports published and made publicly available, in accordance with internationally recognized transparency standards
Results of SESA publicly disclosed by the Government
MOF capacity to support Natural Resource Fund implementation enhanced
Environmental Protection Agency's capacity to regulate and monitor the O&G sector enhanced
